LineComment.Text: Zero out all data on comm error
1 RDY_RUN 0 = OFF1 active, 1 = Ready to operate
8 AT_SETPOINT 1 = actual value within tolerance of Ref
Further optional processing based on variant
0 OFF1_CONTROL 0 = OFF1 Active, 1 = Proceed to READY TO OPERATE
3 INHIBIT_OPERATION 0 = inhibit, 1 = Proceed to OPERATION ENABLED (Run?)
4 RAMP_OUT_ZERO 0 = force ramp output to zero, 1 = normal operation
5 RAMP_HOLD 0 = halt ramping (hold output), 1 = normal operation
6 RAMP_IN_ZERO 0 = force ramp input to zero, 1 = normal operation
8 JOGGING_1 0 = normal operation, 1 = run at Jogging 1 speed
9 JOGGING_2 0 = normal operation, 1 = run at Jogging 2 speed
NOTE: the firmware manual describes a state machine for starting the drive. But the transitions from
one state to another are levels and not edges, therefore several conditions can be combined and sent
NOTE 2: sTag.Cmd.bReady is for enabling the drive without running it; sTag.Cmd.bRun will override this, so don't use bReady to turn the drive on and off
Allow Manual Mode to take over from auto in run state and with same setpoints

AttributeList.Text: Outputs get written even if there is comm error
